sentence.Network_en: Believing yourself to be in the wrong job can be soul-destroying.
sentence.Network_cn: 认为自己入错了行的想法会使人心灰意冷。

sentence.Network_en: Love songs trick us into believing in knights in shining armor.
sentence.Network_cn: 情歌哄骗我们去相信有勇救美人的英雄。

sentence.Network_en: He is, assuredly, not alone in believing they will win.
sentence.Network_cn: 毫无疑问，不止他一个人认为他们会赢。

entry.def: If you believe that something is true, you think that it is true, but you are not sure.

example.ex: Experts believe that the coming drought will be extensive...
example.tran: 专家们认为即将发生的旱灾将侵袭大片地区。

example.ex: I believe you have something of mine...
example.tran: 我想你拿了我什么东西。

entry.def: If you believe someone or if you believe what they say or write, you accept that they are telling the truth.

example.ex: He did not sound as if he believed her...
example.tran: 他听起来似乎并不相信她。

example.ex: Never believe anything a married man says about his wife...
example.tran: 永远不要相信一个已婚男人说的任何有关他妻子的话。

entry.def: If you believe in fairies, ghosts, or miracles, you are sure that they exist or happen. If you believe in a god, you are sure of the existence of that god.

example.tran: 你相信魔法真的存在吗？

entry.tran: 认为…是应该的（或正确的）
entry.def: If you believe in a way of life or an idea, you are in favour of it because you think it is good or right.

example.tran: 信奉民主政治的正派候选人

entry.def: If you believe in someone or what they are doing, you have confidence in them and think that they will be successful.

example.ex: If you believe in yourself you can succeed.

entry.def: Believe is used in expressions such as I can't believe how or it's hard to believe that in order to express surprise, for example because something bad has happened or something very difficult has been achieved.

example.ex: Many officers I spoke to found it hard to believe what was happening around them...
example.tran: 很多和我谈过的官员都觉得发生在他们周围的事情令人难以置信。

example.ex: I was a physical and emotional wreck — I still can't believe how I ever got any work done.
example.tran: 我那时身心俱疲——现在还难以相信我是怎么把一些事情做成的。

entry.tran: （表示对所见所闻惊讶不已）相信自己的眼睛/耳朵
entry.def: If you say that you cannot believe your eyes or cannot believe your ears, you are emphasizing that you are very surprised about something you have seen or heard.

example.ex: I could not believe my eyes. She was far more beautiful than I had imagined.
example.tran: 我简直不敢相信自己的眼睛。她比我想象的漂亮多了。

entry.tran: （强调刚才所述之事令人吃惊）信不信由你
entry.def: You can use believe it or not to emphasize that what you have just said is surprising.

example.ex: That's normal, believe it or not.

entry.tran: （强调对某事感到惊讶）你会相信吗？
entry.def: If you say would you believe it, you are emphasizing your surprise about something.

example.ex: And would you believe it, he's younger than me!

entry.def: You can use believe you me to emphasize that what you are saying is true.

example.ex: It's absolutely amazing, believe you me.

means.word_mean: 1. the cognitive process that leads to convictions;

auth_sentence.content: It's nothing but rumour and not worth believing.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's nothing but rumour and not worth believing.

Sentence.sentence: We must be honest about our actions and avoid excuses, if we fool ourselves into believing we're not doing anything wrong, we can't see the real choice we're making - and that leads to bad decisions.
And instead, I grew up believing that I was supposed to be totally independent and consequently became very reluctant to ask for help.

That notion is not concrete enough and it blurs two key components of hope,' Doctor Snyder said, 'Having hope means believing you have both the will and the way to accomplish your goals, whatever they may be.
